q: POLITICS-- February 8, 2011 at 9:08 AM EDT In New Memoir, Donald Rumsfeld Settles Scores, Spreads Responsibility for Iraq War At its heart, it is a revenge memoir, writes NewsHour senior correspondent Gwen Ifill in her Washington Post review of former secretary of defense Donald Rumsfeld 's new book, "Known and Unknowns." The book certainly includes its fair share of score settling

. In a lengthy section on the administration's treatment of wartime detainees, Donald Rumsfeld regrets not leaving office in May 2004, after the Abu Ghraib prison scandal erupted, The Washington Post said. Looking back, I see there are things the administration could have done differently and better with respect to wartime detention, Donald Rumsfeld acknowledges.

In deciding who should take the business forward, we wanted someone with the right mix of leadership, vision and hard-core engineering chops," chief executive Steve Ballmer wrote in an email to company employees that Microsoft published. We wanted someone who could define the future of business computing and further expand our ability to bring the cloud to business customers and developers in game-changing ways. One of the feathers in Satya Nadella 's cap includes leading the technical efforts on the launch of Microsoft's Bing search engine, new releases of MSN, and the integration of Yahoo! across Bing and adCenter.

CAW President Ken Lewenza said Monday that the employees appreciate the recognition.. I think it's a vote of confidence for the direction of Chrysler corporation and obviously Sergio Marchionne appreciates the kind of work ethic that has been developing in the plants in terms of changing its culture, said Lewenza. CAW Local 444 President Rick Laporte reiterated there is no question the workers have helped put the company on the right track, but he was a little concerned about the bonus idea.
